page.title: 14Gayton Village Hall
page.content: In 1981 it was realised by certain members of the village that something had to be done about the village hall. It was in desperate need of modernisation. The village hall is usually the heart of a community where people can meet and socialise but as Gayton village hall was in such poor repair village people were joining groups and using halls in neighbouring villages. Now in 1985, after much fundraising, the hall has been re-opened, fully modernised and being used by many village groups such as The Allotment Society Tabletennis Club Womens Institute Evergreen Club Cricket Club and many others. As one villager said, "At last we have a hall to be proud of, let's make sure we use it to the full."
